Pomladni dan s srebrnim leskom
Ljudje iz krajev ob reki Idrijci, kjer je pred tisočletji neandertalec izdelal prvi inštrument na svetu, imajo glasbo v genih, o čemer pričajo številni pevski zbori, folklorne skupine in druge glasbene zasedbe.
03 Nov 2019, 10:11 by Mojca Marot



S srebrnimi nitmi v laseh v srcih ohranjajo pomlad.



Pred slovenskim centrom v Pragi z avtorjem fotografske razstave Rokom Albojem FOTO: ARHIV POMLADNI DAN



Pomladni dan v Pragi po nastopu v slovenskem centru s slovensko veleposlanico Tanjo Strniša, njenim možem Tonijem in vodstvom gostiteljskega društva Jožeta Plečnika. FOTO: ARHIV POMLADNI DAN


Tudi skupina Pomladni dan, v kateri sodelujejo pevke in glasbeniki starejše generacije, prihaja od tam. Njihovi člani so se dolga leta vsak po svoje ukvarjali z glasbo, v resnem obdobju življenj pa so zaradi podobnega pogleda na glasbo in zaradi ljubezni do nje združili moči. Pevke Sonja Ozebek in Tatjana Golja prihajata iz Dolenje Trebuše, Mirjam Klinkon iz Modreja pri Mostu na Soči, harmonikar Rado Kovačič iz Dolenje Trebuše, a živi v Volčah, kitarist Teodor Čujec - Tedi je Tolminec, basist Milan Jež je prav tako Trebušan, ki živi v Novi Gorici, harmonikar, klaviaturist in aranžer Bogdan Kosmač, nečak pisatelja Cirila Kosmača, pa prihaja s Slapa ob Idrijci, kjer imata v Kosmačevi Bukovci skupina Pomladni dan in Kulturno-umetniško društvo Pomladni dan, pod katerega okriljem skupina deluje, tudi sedež.
Opevajo domače kraje


Pred slovenskim centrom v Pragi z avtorjem fotografske razstave Rokom Albojem FOTO: ARHIV POMLADNI DAN

»Preigravamo glasbo iz druge polovice prejšnjega stoletja, predvsem zaradi domačega glasbenega izraza in odličnih besedil. Prav tako opevamo domače kraje in njih posebneže. Pripravljamo pa še nekaj avtorskih skladb, ki bodo kmalu ugledale luč sveta,« nam pove Milan Jež, priznani pesnik in tekstopisec. Kot dodaja, so Pomladni dan nekomercialna skupina, ki se rada odzove povabilu na nastop. Med zadnje odmevnejše spadajo majski koncert Pomladni praznični pozdrav, ki so ga pripravili z Mešanim pevskim zborom Zdravko Munih z Mosta na Soči, ki ga vodi njihova pevka Mirjam Klinkon, nastop v tolminskem kino gledališču in avgustovski Koncert pri fontani na starem tolminskem placu.
V Prago
Pred kratkim pa so se vrnili z gostovanja na Češkem, kjer so v Pragi nastopili ob odprtju fotografske razstave trebuškega rojaka Roka Alboja v organizaciji Slovenskega društva Jožeta Plečnika, ki ga vodi predsednik Iztok Toplak. Slovenski večer je z nagovorom obogatila slovenska veleposlanica na Češkem Tanja Strniša.»Mi smo res vsestranski, saj izvajamo tudi glasbo Avsenikov, preigravamo uspešnice skupine Pepel in kri in oživljamo prelepe skladbe Borisa Kovačiča. Nastopamo tudi kot skupina ljudskih godcev in pevk, s čimer izkazujemo ljubezen in spoštovanje do narodnega blaga. In četudi se na nastopih pohvalimo, da smo pomladniki samo še lepi, mladost pa nas je že zapustila, v naših srcih večno živi pomladni dan, ki je mlad in lep, kot bi bil iz srebra ulit. Glasbo pa delimo med poslušalce tudi zato, ker tako ohranjamo spomin na našega velikega rojaka Cirila Kosmača,« pravi Jež.Preigravamo glasbo iz druge polovice prejšnjega stoletja, predvsem zaradi domačega glasbenega izraza in odličnih besedil.

Spring day with silver glitter
People from places along the Idrijca River, where the Neanderthal made the first instrument in the world thousands of years ago, have music in genes, as evidenced by numerous choirs, folk groups and other bands.
03 Nov 2019, 10:11 by Mojca Marot



With silver threads in their hair, they keep spring in the hearts.



In front of the Slovenian Center in Prague with the author of the photography exhibition Roko Albo PHOTO: ARCHIVE SPRING DAY



Spring day in Prague after a performance at the Slovenian Center with Slovenian Ambassador Tanja Strnis, her husband Toni and the management of the host society Joze Plečnik. PHOTO: ARCHIVE SPRING DAY


Even the Spring Day band, featuring older generation singers and musicians, comes from there. For many years, their members have been individually engaged in music, but in a serious period of their lives they have joined forces for a similar outlook on music and for the love of it. Singers Sonja Ozebek and Tatjana Golja come from Dolenje Trebuša, Mirjam Klinkon from Modrej pri Most na Soči, accordion player Rado Kovačič from Dolenje Trebuša, but lives in Volče, guitarist Teodor Čujec - Tedi is Tolminec, bassist Milan Jež is also Trebušan, who lives in Nova Gorica, accordionist, keyboardist and arranger Bogdan Kosmac, a nephew of writer Cyril Kosmac, comes from Slap ob Idrijci, where in Kosmac's Bukovci the Spring Day group and the Spring Day Cultural and Art Society, under whose auspices the group, also have headquarters.
They sing the hometowns


In front of the Slovenian Center in Prague with the author of the photography exhibition Roko Albo PHOTO: ARCHIVE SPRING DAY

“We play music from the second half of the last century, mainly because of our domestic musical expression and excellent lyrics. We also sing hometowns and their specialties. However, we are preparing some more compositions that will soon catch the light of the world, "says Milan Jež, a renowned poet and songwriter. Spring Day is a non-commercial group that likes to respond to the invitation to perform. The last major ones include the May Concert Spring Holiday Greetings, prepared by the Mixed Choir Zdravko Munih from Most na Soci, lead by their singer Mirjam Klinkon, a performance at the Tolmin Cinema Theater and the August Concert at the Fountain on the Old Tolmin Plateau.
To Prague
Recently, however, they returned from a guest appearance in the Czech Republic, where they performed in Prague at the opening of a photo exhibition of the belly-born countryman Rok Albo, organized by the Slovenian Society Jože Plečnik, led by President Iztok Toplak. Slovene Ambassador to the Czech Republic, Tanja Strnis, enriched the evening with an address: "We are really versatile, since we also perform Avsenikov music, play the hits of the Ashes and Blood group and bring to life the beautiful compositions of Boris Kovacic. We also act as a group of folk gods and singers, showing love and respect for national goods. And even though we boast in the performances that we are only beautiful in the spring, but the youth has already left us, there is forever in our hearts a spring day that is young and beautiful, as if it were cast from silver. We also share the music with the listeners because we preserve the memory of our great compatriot Cyril Kosmač, "says Jež. We play music from the second half of the last century, mainly because of our domestic musical expression and excellent lyrics.
